intro: Diplycosia minutiflora var. glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular-flowered diplycosia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Melastomataceae. It is characterized by its small, glandular-dotted leaves and clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, and is native to regions in Southeast Asia. Its foliage often has a distinctive aromatic quality due to the presence of glandular structures. The species is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
